results.title: Inja = Dog
results.creator_credit: Steve Pasvolsky, Joe Weatherstone and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
South Africa, 1980s. Using a young Xhosa boy as a pawn, a farmer teaches his puppy to be white man’s best friend. Ten years later, both their lives hang in the balance at the mercy of the dog.
Filmed on location at Bien Donne Werf, Franschhoek Valley, South Africa.
In English/Afrikaans/Xhosa with English subtitles

results.title: Basilisk stare
results.creator_credit: Mis Kamieniak, Chryss Carr and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A psychosexual drama which launches the viewer into the inner-space of the male psyche in order to depict the way the modern male constructs sex. The film excites and disturbs the viewer with the use of a split screen, which allows for the pitching of two images against each other in order to create a sense of both excitement and voyeuristic curiosity.
Cast includes David Wenham, Amy Pedersen and Jared Turner

results.title: Together in the middle of nowhere
results.creator_credit: Tony Krawitz, Rachel Clements and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Vince embarks on an odyssey through the city streets while his girlfriend Jacqui works in a stripclub until dawn. Over one night they journey into the darkness of their own hearts to find out what really matters. Cast includes Mark Priestley as Vince and Hayley McElhinney as Jacqui

results.title: Vasili's garden
results.brief_description: Welcome to Vasili’s Garden, a fun and very organic gardening show with lots of entertainment. Vasili enters people’s lives via the garden gate and together with the garden’s creator he delves into the private world beyond the backyard fence exploring their gardening obsessions and fantasies, sharing their tips and common sense. A tour around everyday gardens presented in both Greek and English with helpful tips and advice.

results.title: RAW. Episode 3
results.creator_credit: Josh Lefers, Nick McInerney, Stephen Wools, Big Dog Productions and C31 Melbourne
results.brief_description: AIRED 19 April 2006. RAW is fast becoming a cult classic. The show follows Josh and Steve on urban adventures and into social experiments: from racing trams and street sweepers, to stealing bibles and creating a revolutionary system of economy with their epic Freeshit ManTM. These boys will do anything as long as it is ridiculous.

results.title: Ticket, passport and tarot cards. Episode 18. The Star
results.brief_description: AIRED 29 December 2005 Based on a popular book from Tarot expert Linda Marson, this series is a a unique combination of personal diary, travel journal and Tarot imagery. Screened as a weekly show on Channel 31 in Melbourne, T, P and TC was a five minute filler program that screened from 1 September 2005 - 26 January 2006.

results.title: C News focus: Monday 22 May 2006
results.brief_description: Private lives of public figures. Aired 22 May 2006 this episode focuses on the media, and their coverage of the private lives of public figures. Independent MP Andrew Olexander is interviewed on what it feels like to be the subject of such scrutiny.

results.title: Plug-in. Episode 2
results.creator_credit: Salvador Castro, Simon Moule and C31 Melbourne
results.brief_description: Aired 07 April 2005. Plug-in is a fifteen minute television program that aired weekly on channel 31 in 2005 (season 2 scheduled from July 2006) . Each fifteen minutes consisted of a major and minor documentary as well as a vox pop montage relating to the major piece. Within this framework a broad range of material is presented, from profiles of the day-to-day workings of community organizations to documentaries and political animation. Plug-in presents material on indigenous rights and reconciliation, migrant issues, environment, education, health, culture, arts and dissent. In 2005 Plug In TV won 2 Antenna Awards (Australian Community Television Awards) for best editing, and best sound and was nominated for best show of the year.

results.title: City of chromatic dissolution
results.brief_description:
Arthur and Corinne Cantrill used footage of Melbourne’s cityscapes and buildings from the mid 1980s to create this evocative piece on movement, colour and the city. The various parts of inner city Melbourne were originally shot on black and white negative in three colour separation, then printed on Eastmancolor film. The results are static shots of the city, where the movement of people and vehicles have a quality that is colour saturated and ghostly. This is complemented with a sountrack both urban and discordant in tone.
This is one of a series of films made by the Cantrills that experiment with dramatic distortions of colour through three-colour separation processes. The original inspiration for this project (as the filmmakers report in the final edition of Cantrills Filmnotes) came back in the mid-1970s when Kodak stopped making the Cantrills’ preferred 16mm reversal colour film stocks.

results.title: A Woman under the influence
results.brief_description: The title of this film refers to a wife and mother, Mabel Longhetti, who moves completely under the influence of her family and other people. She tries so hard to perform and conform, according to what she perceives they want, but she just comes across as “crazy” and the family are embarrassed. In the confusion, the film makes Mabel an expressive centre, focusing on the commotion she causes and the forms of agitation that extend across her face and body.
